DataElement.preferredDefinition: Name of the Trial Epoch with which this Element of the Arm is associated or Trial epoch (e.g., DOUBLE BLIND, SINGLE BLIND, TREATMENT, SCREENING, RUN IN) for which subject disposition is being collected.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A collection of data variables or metadata for use with a Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) data submission. Representative examples include Laboratory (LB), Subject Characteristics (SC), and Trial Summary (TS)._One of a set of ordered partitions of an experimental unit's participation in a study. An Epoch represents a state within a study such that subjects in separate arms within that state are comparable. Each epoch serves a purpose in the trial as a whole, typically exposing the subject to a treatment or preparing them for a treatment, or gathering post-treatment data. Activities and activity results control the subject's movement from one epoch to another. EXAMPLE(S): A study designed to assess the effects of treatments might have 3 epochs. A Screening Epoch in which subjects' eligibility is determined and baseline measurements are made. A Treatment Epoch during which treatments are given and effects of treatment are assessed. A Follow-up Epoch during which post-treatment assessments are conducted. NOTE(S): A subject moves from one epoch to another and can only be in one epoch at a time. The subject can only move to an epoch with a greater sequenceNumber. Activities in the same epoch but a different arm need not be similar in time and pattern. Subjects in different arms will not necessarily pass through the same epochs.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A collection of data variables or metadata for use with a Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) data submission. Representative examples include Laboratory (LB), Subject Characteristics (SC), and Trial Summary (TS).

Concepts.definition: A collection of data variables or metadata for use with a Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) data submission. Representative examples include Laboratory (LB), Subject Characteristics (SC), and Trial Summary (TS).

Property.preferredDefinition: A portion of a study containing one or more study segments with a consistent objective such as screening subjects or treating disease.

Concepts.definition: A portion of a study containing one or more study segments with a consistent objective such as screening subjects or treating disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2021-6-9 ak Released per governance approval.; 85.6.2021 No requests for release or designation for reuse. mc /9/18 Created as part of the CDISC mapping task; tt.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Terminology associated with the epoch codelist of the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM)._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A period in a clinical study during which subjects receive blinded therapeutic treatment.

Concepts.definition: A period in a clinical study during which subjects receive blinded therapeutic treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A period in a clinical study during which subjects receive open label therapeutic treatment.

Concepts.definition: A period in a clinical study during which subjects receive open label therapeutic treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A period in a clinical study during which a subject's base standard measurements are collected and recorded for use in future comparisons and analyses.

Concepts.definition: A period in a clinical study during which a subject's base standard measurements are collected and recorded for use in future comparisons and analyses.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A period in a clinical study that occurs before the commencement of the primary clinical study investigation, during which subjects may be assessed for suitability in the clinical study, withdrawn from existing therapy, trained in study methodology or evaluated for any other protocol-specified reason.

Concepts.definition: A period in a clinical study that occurs before the commencement of the primary clinical study investigation, during which subjects may be assessed for suitability in the clinical study, withdrawn from existing therapy, trained in study methodology or evaluated for any other protocol-specified reason.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A period in a clinical study during which subjects receive therapeutic treatment.

Concepts.definition: A period in a clinical study during which subjects receive therapeutic treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A period in a clinical study during which subjects receive continuation therapy. This therapy is usually different from the therapy given during the induction phase and administered over a longer period of time.

Concepts.definition: A period in a clinical study during which subjects receive continuation therapy. This therapy is usually different from the therapy given during the induction phase and administered over a longer period of time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A period in a clinical study during which subjects receive induction therapy.

Concepts.definition: A period in a clinical study during which subjects receive induction therapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A period of time to allow one agent to clear the body before another agent can be safely introduced.  Washout periods vary depending on the agents involved.

Concepts.definition: A period of time to allow one agent to clear the body before another agent can be safely introduced.  Washout periods vary depending on the agents involved.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A period in a clinical study during which subjects are observed, without planned interventions.

Concepts.definition: A period in a clinical study during which subjects are observed, without planned interventions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A period in a clinical study during which subjects are evaluated prior to entering the full screening period.

Concepts.definition: A period in a clinical study during which subjects are evaluated prior to entering the full screening period.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A period in a clinical study during which subjects are evaluated for participation in the study.

Concepts.definition: A period in a clinical study during which subjects are evaluated for participation in the study.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A period in a clinical study during which information about the health status of an individual is obtained long after study interventions have concluded.

Concepts.definition: A period in a clinical study during which information about the health status of an individual is obtained long after study interventions have concluded.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A period in a clinical study during which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after study interventions have concluded.

Concepts.definition: A period in a clinical study during which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after study interventions have concluded.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Terminology associated with the epoch codelist of the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM).:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: Terminology associated with the epoch codelist of the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM).
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Exposure as Collected Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the same information is collected more than once in different periods/parts of a study (e.g., Disposition), EPOCH may be needed to differentiate them. Typically, the trial epoch will be pre-printed on the CRF as the title of the page. See SDTMIG for further information regarding EPOCH.

ReferenceDocuments.name: EPOCH
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Exposure as Collected CRF Completion Instructions
CDASH Exposure Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the same information is collected more than once in different periods/parts of a study (e.g., Disposition), EPOCH may be needed to differentiate them. Typically, the trial epoch will be pre-printed on the CRF as the title of the page. See SDTMIG for further information regarding EPOCH.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: If disposition events are collected more than once in the study, EPOCH may be needed to differentiate them. Typically, the trial epoch will be pre-printed on the CRF as the title of the page; however, some companies have a standard CRF module that includes a pick-list of epochs. See SDTMIG for further information regarding EPOCH. EPOCH would only be populated for disposition event and not for protocol milestones.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: What is the trial period for this disposition event?

ReferenceDocuments.name: DS Case Report Form Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Check the [epoch, or insert more appropriate wording] for which disposition is being recorded.

ReferenceDocuments.name: DS CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: If disposition events are collected more than once in the study, EPOCH may be needed to differentiate them. Typically, the trial epoch will be pre-printed on the CRF as the title of the page; however, some companies have a standard CRF module that includes a pick-list of epochs. See SDTMIG for further information regarding EPOCH. EPOCH would only be populated for disposition event and not for protocol milestones.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Terminology associated with the epoch codelist of the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM).
